Description: Woman's hair-ornament ('uqus), composed of three plaited cotton cords, dyed red, terminating in plaited tassels. Numerous pierced metal rings encircle ends of main plaits. Central plait has small red drawstring bag, made of synthetic material, attached by cotton cord.
Curator's comments: Hair plaits are worn at the back of the woman's head and interwoven with natural hair. Attached cloth bags or purses are used to carry money or valuables.
Condition: Fair; red cotton now faded, bag is damaged.
Acquisition notes: Af1994,01.1 to 4 were purchased from J Stuart Ackary, and were descibed as "a small collection, mainly from Bahriyah Oasis in the Western Desert (Sahara) of Egypt, including an embroidered dress and other items of female personal adornment."
